answers.text:
Hi Marvin, 
Unfortunately we do not have any articles that directly deal with leasing islands to local non profits but we do have these two resources that deal with leasing and re-purposing land owned by the local government. Hopefully these two resources can help as your city develops a draft.
-This article provides examples of how local governments have allowed local organizations to use abandoned or unused city property in interesting ways. http://icma.org/en/BlogPost/333/Reusing_Vacant_Property
-The Tulsa Asset Management guide shows how leasing of lands can be dealt with although it is not specific to islands. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/305488
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Marvin Collins
text:
The City was approached by a community non-profit interested in using a small, undeveloped island in the river as a passive recreation site. The City requested the organization to provide a concept plan for review. The City is developing a draft lease/use agreement for consideration. 

The City is seeking examples of lease or use agreements that provide for the lease of a city-owned island to a non-profit for use and or development as a passive recreation facility.
I am interested in any past experiences other managers or organizations encountered in like or similar situations.

You time and thoughts are appreciated.
title: Island Lease to Non-profit for Passive Recreation Use
